turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Devil's Gorge (Eifel).
turn.1: What is known about the Devil's Gorge?
turn.2: Devil's Gorge (Eifel) The Devil's Gorge or Teufelsschlucht is located on the eastern edge of the Ferschweiler Plateau within the South Eifel Nature Park in the vicinity of Irrel.
turn.4: It was formed towards the end of the last ice age, about 10,000 years ago as the result of one or more rock collapses.
turn.6: The cause of this event was probably a combination of the geological and climatic circumstances.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: The heavily fissured, more or less porous, rock strata of the so-called Luxembourg Sandstone (geologically part of the Lower Jurassic or German Lias) are laid over keuper beds that tend towards being impervious.
turn.10: As weathering progresses, the structure becomes unstable as a result of the undercutting of the sandstone base.
turn.11: Did it cause any other problems?
turn.12: Towards the end of the last glaciation period this undercutting, in combination with extensive frost shattering, reached the point where it caused the aforementioned rock collapse.
